intro: Acisanthera bracteosa, commonly known as the bracteosa acisanthera, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Africa and is characterized by its distinctive bracteate inflorescences. The plant features palmate leaves with lobed margins and produces small, woolly flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forest understories or along stream banks. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and as a landscape plant.
